thread.title: Eugenie Bouchard suing USTA over slip-fall at US Open
thread.title_full: Eugenie Bouchard suing USTA over slip-fall at US Open

author: MICHAEL BALSAMO
title: Eugenie Bouchard suing USTA over slip-fall at US Open
text:
Charles Krupa Eugenie Bouchard suing USTA over slip-fall at US Open 
FILE- In this Sept. 4, 2015 file photo, Eugenie Bouchard, of Canada, returns a shot to Dominika Cibulkova, of Slovakia, during the third round of the U.S. Open tennis tournament in New York. Bouchard has filed a lawsuit against the United States Tennis Association on Wednesday, Oct. 14, 2015, after she fell in a locker room during the U.S. Open. She claimed that the fall, caused by a “slippery, foreign and dangerous substance” on the floor resulted in a severe head injury, which caused her to withdraw from the tournament. (AP Photo/Charles Krupa, File) Charles Krupa Eugenie Bouchard suing USTA over slip-fall at US Open 
FILE- In this Sept. 4, 2015 file photo, Eugenie Bouchard, of Canada, returns a shot to Dominika Cibulkova, of Slovakia, during the third round of the U.S. Open tennis tournament in New York. Bouchard has filed a lawsuit against the United States Tennis Association on Wednesday, Oct. 14, 2014, after she fell in the locker room at the U. S. Open, sustaining a head injury which she claims caused her to withdraw from the tournament. (AP Photo/Charles Krupa, File) Posted: Wednesday, October 14, 2015 9:03 pm | Updated: 10:01 pm, Wed Oct 14, 2015. Eugenie Bouchard suing USTA over slip-fall at US Open Associated Press | 0 comments 
NEW YORK (AP) — Tennis star Eugenie Bouchard filed a lawsuit Wednesday against the United States Tennis Association that alleges the sport's national governing body was negligent, leaving her to slip and fall in a locker room during the U.S. Open. 
Bouchard, who was a runner-up at Wimbledon last year, has suffered severe pain and economic loss after the Sept. 4 incident, she said in the federal lawsuit filed in U.S. District Court in Brooklyn that seeks unspecified monetary damages. kAm%96 a`\J62C\@=5 q@F492C5 925 ;FDE H@? 2 >2E49 282:?DE s@>:?:<2 r:3F=<@G2 H96?
